Description.div:
The OrderHeaderKey attribute or the EnterpriseCode, DocumentType and OrderNo attributes must be passed to identify the Order.
The order cannot be identified.

The ReturnOrderHeaderKeyForExchange, ExchangeType and OrderPurpose attributes must be passed to convert a sales order to an exchange order.
If ReturnOrderHeaderKeyForExchange, ExchangeType or OrderPurpose attributes are not passed
A sales order that has some authorized or collected amount cannot be converted to an exchange order with ExchangeType as REGULAR

Action to perform on this order.
Default: MODIFY
Valid Values:
CANCEL - Cancels the entire order. For master orders, please refer to the cancelMasterOrder API for more details. For quotes, quantities on the lines will not be reduced, but statuses will move to 9000.
REMOVE - Removes the entire order. This is allowed only for draft orders.
MODIFY - Change values in the order.

If ApplyOnlyItemLevelPricingRules is passed as Y then pricing rules that are applicable at the item level will be run.
Pricing rules with IsItemRule value as 'Y' are executed.
Passed coupons with IsItemRule value as 'Y' are executed.
Order total pricing rules are suppressed.
Shipping charge calculation, shipping rules execution and shipping coupon execution are suppressed.
Default value is N .

Date on which order will automatically cancelled. If not provided, no change will be done to the existing auto cancel date. If provided, the order monitor agent is will cancel the orders automatically after this Date.

This is the User Id of the customer for which order is created. This field maps to User_Id field of YFS_Customer_Contact. If BuyerUserId is passed, then the customer contact is looked up in the entire customer hierarchy.
BuyerUserId has an aggregate status of inactive.

Optional. This flag indicates whether processing for pricing should be performed.
Default: N
If set to Y , processing for pricing will not be performed. It is assumed that pricing information is provided in the input to the api.

This is the customer contact ID for the order. This field maps to contact ID field of YFS_Customer_Contact. If both BuyerUserId and CustomerContactID are passed, then both the fields must map to a unique customer contact. If CustomerContactID is passed, the customer contact is looked up only for the customer and not in the entire customer hierarchy.
CustomerContactID is invalid.

Indicates if the billing, shiping, payment, tax, and currency information on the order should be defaulted from the customer information. When the flag is set to "Y", and a valid customer is found, the billing, shipping, and tax information on the order will be defaulted either from the customer or from the customer contact. The payment method on the order will only be defaulted if there is no payment method on the order. The currency will only be defaulted if the customer's IsDefaultCurrency is set to 'Y'.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

The channel through which this order was created. If the value of EntryType on the order matches the value of the common code Entry_Type, the common code's attributes are considered during order validation.

Conditional. Identifies the exchange type of the order. The payment processing logic is dependent on this attribute. Valid values are: REGULAR, ADVANCED_PP, ADVANCED.
Mandatory for exchange order.
Exchange type should be defined in common code.
A sales order that has some authorized or collected amount cannot be converted to an exchange order with ExchangeType as REGULAR

This attribute is deprecated as of Sterling Supply Chain Applications 7.1. If you want to use pre 7.1 functionality, set the rule 'Use pre 7.1 hold Functionality'. If the rule is not set, this flag is set/reset by the application. Application sets HoldFlag to 'Y' if order has any hold types or any order line has any hold types. Flag is reset to 'N' if there are no hold types on order and all order lines. This flag should not be passed when rule is not set. There are no validations for this but value can be reset by the application based on hold types on order.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Attribute.Name: MaskPaymentInfoWhenLoggingAudits
Attribute.Description:
This flag indicates if the sensitive payment information is masked while logging the audits for the Order. These payment information are CreditCardNo,CustomerAccountNo,SvcNo,PaymentReference1.
Valid Values: Y or N

Description.div:
Conditional. This indicates specific purpose this order is created for. Should be passed EXCHANGE to convert an sales order to exchange order. If OrderPurpose is EXCHANGE, then ReturnOrderHeaderKeyForExchange must be specified.
Either OrderPurpose,Return_OH_Key_For_Exchange not passed.

If the value of Override is Y , then the modification will be allowed regardless of the status modification rules provided entity is within system supplied status range. If it is N , the status modification rules will need to be taken into account in determining whether or not this modification can occur.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Attribute.Name: ProcessPaymentOnReturnOrder
Attribute.Description: Indicates that payment methods should be copied onto the return order and that refunds should be processed there, as opposed to the original sales order. This is only valid for return orders. ReturnByGiftRecipient attribute should not be combined with ProcessPaymentOnReturnOrder="Y", if used togeather ReturnByGiftRecipient takes higher precedence.

Attribute.Name: RetainAnswerSets
Attribute.Description: This flag indicates if upon ship-to address change, the answer sets for the old address should be copied to be used for the new address.

Description.div:
Optional. Flag used by return orders to indicate if the return is initiated by the gift recipient. If ReturnByGiftRecipient is 'N', then payment methods will NOT be copied from the original sales orders to the return order; instead refunds will be processed on the sales orders. ReturnByGiftRecipient attribute should not be combined with ProcessPaymentOnReturnOrder="Y", if used togeather ReturnByGiftRecipient takes higher precedence.
If flag is passed 'Y' for non-return document.
All the lines of this return should be for the same ShipTo address.

Conditional. Identifies the return order header key for which this exchange order is getting created. If OrderPurpose is passed, ReturnOrderHeaderKeyForExchange is required.
Mandatory for exchange order.
Either OrderPurpose,Return_OH_Key_For_Exchange not passed.
A return order should exist for the passed key.
No other exchange order should exist for this key.
While associating a exchange order with the return order, the return order should have not been invoiced.

This attribute determines whether database select operations are carried out in the WAIT or NO_WAIT mode.
Default: NO_WAIT
Valid Values: WAIT or NO_WAIT mode.

Seller Organization Code of the order.
SellerOrganizationCode may not be changed for an existing order.
Fact columns cannot be modified upon creation.

Attribute.Name: ShipToID
Attribute.Description: This attribute value will be updated only at the order header level and will not be propagated to the order lines.

Description.div: Determines whether BOM XML specific validations should be skipped. Default: N

Attribute.Name: SourcingClassification
Attribute.Description: This attribute will be used to determine node for sourcing.

Description.div:
Flag to indicate if com.yantra.ypm.japi.ue.YPMValidateExternalPromotionsUE userexit should be invoked if implemented to validate external promotions.
Valid Values: Y or N
Default: N
First name of the customer placing the order.
Last name of the customer placing the order.
Daytime Phone number of the customer placing the order.
Address Zip Code of the customer placing the order.
This element is used to manage pending changes on the order.

If the OrderLine exists, it is updated with the value passed to it.
If the line does not exist and Action is passed as CREATE , the line is created; any other value passed for Action generates an error.
The following attributes cannot be changed for a Product OrderLine if it is associated to a Delivery Line. For changing this value, it should be changed on Delivery line and change is propogated to all the associated Product Lines:
1. PersonInfoShipTo
2. ReqShipDate
3. ReqDeliveryDate
4. ReceivingNode
5. ShipNode
6. MergeNode
When a date or node is changed on an OrderLine, the change applies only to the non-scheduled quantities on that line.
ShipNode change on a DS line with any scheduled quantities.
Line is a bundle parent and child lines are automatically created based on the components of the bundle in the catalog, which contains a model item.

Action to perform on this OrderLine.
Default: Null - if not passed, the OrderLine will be created if it doesn't exist or updated if it does exist.
Valid Values:
CANCEL - Tries to cancel the OrderLine if cancellable. If the quantity of a Service or Delivery line is reduce to zero by cancellation, the associations for that line are also removed. If the quantity is partially reduced, the association is not be removed. Not a valid action for draft orders. For master orders, please refer to the cancelMasterOrder API for more detials.
REMOVE - Removes the entire OrderLine. This is allowed only for draft orders.
CREATE - Adds a new line.
MODIFY - Changes a line.
REPLACE_BUNDLE - This action should be passed only for existing bundle parent order lines.
Action REPLACE_BUNDLE is passed for order lines not having kit code as BUNDLE
Action REPLACE_BUNDLE is passed for new order lines
Action Cancel is not allowed in pending mode when other pending changes exist.

Attribute.Name: AllocationDate
Attribute.Description: The date when this line will be allocated. This is calculated at order creation time, based on the node processing time. This field is not used from version 50 onwards. The ALLOCATION_LEAD_TIME field is used instead.

Description.div:
The BOM XML to be used to create the order line and its components.
BOMXML is passed without passing Action as REPLACE_BUNDLE

Describes how product is delivered. Only valid for Product line having ItemGroupCode value of PROD .
Valid Values:
DEL - Delivery
SHP - Ship
CARRY - Cash And Carry
PICK - Pickup by the user.
Orderlines having Cash And Carry delivery method are ignored while scheduling the order.
if DeliveryMethod is being changed from a delivery method that requires immediate settlement to one that does not (for example, from CARRY to SHIP), then SettledQuantity will be set to zero.
If DeliveryMethod is changed for an existing line, it must be a valid value.
The DeliveryMethod cannot be modified if the OrderLine has been scheduled. If changing DeliveryMethod from DEL to a new value, there should be no association present with a delivery line.

This field can be used for line classification and reporting purposes. If department code is passed at order header but not passed at order line then value at order header is pushed to order line. If department code is changed at order header and previous value is same as value with Order line then new value of order header is pushed to order line. If department code is changed at order line and previous value is same as value with shipment line then new value of order line is pushed to shipment line.

Indicates how the OrderLines are dependent on the parent line. The DependencyShippingRule can only be specified for the parent line.
If a DependencyShippingRule is specified on the parent line, it is defaulted to the same value on all the dependent lines. If a DependencyShippingRule is passed on any of the dependent lines, the value passed is ignored.
Default: " " (Null)
Valid values: 01 - Ship together, 02 - Deliver together
If a DependencyShippingRule value is 02 , a MergeNode must be specified. Order release created for these lines have a MergeNode value, so shipments are first made to the MergeNode, where they are consolidated for final shipment.
The DependencyShippingRule can only be specified for Product line. A Product line associated with a delivery line cannot be a part of any dependency shipping rule.
If a DependencyShippingRule is passed for Delivery or Provided Service Line or an associated Product Line.
If MergeNode is not specified for parent line, and DependencyShippingRule value is 02 .
Invalid value is passed.
Use a ModificationType of OTHERS to change this field.
If a DependencyShippingRule is being modified for a line that has dependent-lines associated with it, then the DependencyShippingRule on each of the dependent lines is also changed.
If the DependencyShippingRule is being modified for a dependent line. the change is ignored. The child line retains the parent line's value.
Changing the DependencyShippingRule value does not reset existing dependency attributes from any of the lines. For example, changing the DependencyShippingRule value from 02 to 01 does not remove the MergeNode from any of the lines. Originally, the MergeNode was defaulted from the parent line.
Any OrderLine that is a part of an association cannot specify a DependencytShippingRule.
Based on the DependencyShippingRule, some of attributes on dependent lines are defaulted from the parent line. If the child line has a different value from the parent line, the child line's value is ignored, and the parent lines value is used.
Value
ShippingRule
ShipNode
ReceivingNode
ShipTo
MergeNode
RequiredShipDate
RequiredDeliveryDate
01 defaults
defaults
02
defaults defaults mandatory

Pass if quantity has to be canceled from a specific status.
There is not enough quantity in this status
Should be a valid status for the order's process type. Status equivalent to Cancel - 9000 cannot be specified.

This flag indicates whether the order line should be backordered upon creation. If passed as 'Y', the line will be backordered even if inventory is available. If a reservation ID is passed on the order line and reservation exists for a current, past or future date, reservation will be consumed to block inventory for the backordered demand. In this scenario, demand created by the reservation ID is removed, and a backordered demand will be generated. No attempt is made to look for inventory if reservation is not available for the passed reservation ID. For draft orders, the reservation is consumed and the order line is created in created status. During confirmDraftOrder, this line goes in backordered status. This flag is ignored if reservation is mandatory. This flag should not be passed for bundle parent lines. If it is passed as 'Y' for bundle parent order line, the line is created in backorder status. It is not propagated to bundle components.

Indicates if the pre-defined node on the line is firm or not. If IsFirmPredefinedNode is marked as N, then the node on the line is ignored during scheduling. If not passed, the default value for this Flag is Y. If ProcureFromNode is passed, this flag will always be set to Y. For a DS or a PS line so, it is defaulted to Y. If the ship node is not present on the line but the value passed is Y, then it is treated as N during scheduling.

The preferred minimum ship by date of the available supply that order line can allocate against. Available supply with ship by date earlier than the minimum ship by date will not be considered. This applies to the order line with a valid time-sensitive item. The MinShipByDate of the order line will also be used by all kit lines with valid time-sensitive item.
If MinShipByDate is modified and some quantities of the order line have been scheduled.

The quantity of the line item that has been ordered. If part of line is cancelled, this number is reduced appropriately. If an order line is returned, this number is not reduced.
For a service line item which is used as a standalone service, OrderedQty is treated in the same manner as product lines and must be a non-zero positive number.
The OrderedQty value passed on the service line is ignored, if ordered quantity computaion is not based on entered quantity.
If SerialNo is provided and OrderedQty is not equal to one.
If ReservationManadatory is passed as 'Y' and added quantity cannot be reserved.
Adding quantity on a bundle component is allowed for fixed quantity line or if it does not result in increase in bundle parent line quantity or if quantity is increased on all the components in ratio with bundle parent.

Pipeline id on order line. Before modifying the pipeline make sure all the statuses line is in are valid for the changed pipeline too. API does not check that statuses the line is in are valid for the changed pipeline.
It should be a valid pipeline for the process type order line belongs.
Order line is in a status that cannot be processed by any transaction in the new pipeline.

The node from which the order line should be procured if cannot source from the shipnode on the order line.
ProcureFromNode can be specified only if shipnode is passed.
If Reservation is attempted from ProcureFromNode, then shipnode must have Procure To Ship Allowed Flag set to Y

The date and time when the appointment ends for an OrderLine.
PromisedApptEndDate must be greater than or equal to PromisedApptStartDate.
If PromisedApptEndDate is passed, but PromisedApptStartDate is not passed.
PromisedApptEndDate cannot be modified for product line once it is associated with work order.
PromisedApptEndDate cannot be modified for service if it is part of a complex work order (multi-appointment or appoinment against a service resource) or there are multiple service lines in the work order.
If the date corresponds to a slot which cannot be used for appointment planning.

The date and time when the appointment starts for an OrderLine.
A change to PromisedAppointmentDate of a Delivery line also changes dates for all the associated Product lines.
PromisedApptStartDate cannot be after PromisedApptEndDate.
If PromisedApptStartDate is passed, but PromisedApptEndDate is not passed.
PromisedApptStartDate cannot be modified for product line once it is associated with work order.
PromisedApptStartDate cannot be modified for service if it is part of a complex work order (multi-appointment or appoinment against a service resource) or there are multiple service lines in the work order.
If the date corresponds to a slot which cannot be used for appointment planning.

The node an order line is to be shipped to.
Note: When calling this API for a return order, this ReceivingNode attribute should contain the receiving_node ID associated with the "Ship From" node (the node from which the returned item is shipped).

This attribute should be passed when a line, or quantity to the existing line, is added. This attribute is not applicable to the existing quantity. If this item was reserved before adding a line or a quantity to the line, pass a reservation ID to associate the line with the reservation. If a reservation ID is passed, and the reservation exists for the item, the reservation will be consumed to block inventory.

Attribute.Name: RetainAnswerSets
Attribute.Description: This flag indicates if upon ship-to address change, the answer sets for the old address should be copied to be used for the new address.

Description.div:
Requested serial number of the item.
If SerialNo is provided and OrderedQty is not equal to one.
If SerialNo is provided but ShipNode is not.

Shipping node from which this line should be shipped. If provided, all releases will be made against this node.
Note: When calling this API for a return order, this ShipNode attribute should contain the shipnode_key associated with the "Return To" node (the node to which the returned item is being sent). If ship node is not set to either the order or the orderline and the seller organization is a node then the seller organization's ship node will be set as the ship node for the Cash And Carry order line.
If SerialNo is provided, ShipNode is mandatory
Shipnode cannot be modified on service line once it becomes part of work order.
If ShipNode is provided and ReservationID is provided to represent a capacity reservation for the service line and ShipNode is not the same as the node of the resource pool on the reservation.

The ship to address that is associated with this order line. If not provided, it is defaulted from order header when needed. To remove shipping address from a line, pass ShipToKey as blank and pass PersonInfoShipTo element with all blank attributes or don't pass it.
Times from the database are converted into the timezone specified by this field by the UI. Used with order lines with an ItemGroupCode of PS - Provided Service or DS - Delivery Service.

Pass if quantity has to be added to a specific status. It is only applicable to add quantity. It can also be specified while adding a line. Status must be less than 3200
Should be a valid status for the order's process type. Status equivalent to Cancel - 9000 cannot be specified.

A field used to identify OrderLines when PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo are not passed. Used in line associations. This value is transient, it is not stored in the database.
Must pass one of the following
the PrimaryLineNo's OrderLineKey and the SubLineNo
or
TransactionalLineID

Indicates if item needs to be validated against catalog. If passed, the configuration rule for validating the item will be overridden.
Default: Null
Valid Values: Y or N
The minimum OrderLine quantity that must be fulfilled in an order release before it is shipped.
The quantity of the the line item that has been ordered. If part of line is cancelled, this number is reduced appropriately. If an OrderLine is returned, this number is not reduced.
Quantity which should be settled before it is actually invoiced.
UOM on which all the transactional quantities are specified.

Use this element to derive a new OrderLine from an existing OrderLine. If the passed order line is a bundle parent then all the PROD components that have specified KitQty are also pulled in the derived order. If components do not meet status criteria then error is thrown. Bundle-child relationship is maintained in the derived order if parent and components exist in the same derived order.
The existing OrderLine can be identified by using one of the following:
- OrderLineKey
- OrderHeaderKey, PrimeLineNo, and SubLineNo
- OrderNo, DocumentType, EnterpriseCode, PrimeLineNo, and SubLineNo
If the parent line cannot be identified, an error is thrown.
To select only the part of the existing OrderLine associated with a particular release for derive a new OrderLine, additional data is needed. In addition to the information to identify the existing OrderLine, supply either the OrderReleaseKey or the ReleaseNo that identifies the release.
Information is taken from the parent line, based on the DerivedOrderDefaultTemplate, stored in the YFS_DOCUMENT_TEMPLATE table. The DerivedOrderDefaultTemplate is chosen on the basis of the DocumentType of the child order.
If there are attributes passed in the changeOrder input xml, the values in the passed attributes are used for creating the new OrderLine. If passed line is a bundle parent line, derived lines are created for all the eligible components existing in the parent order. All the attributes which are passed to OrderLine and its children elements are applied to all the components that are created as part of creating derived line from a bundle parent. If KitCode and Item attributes are changed while creating the derived line from bundle parent, result may be unpredictable.
Schedule information is never propagated from the parent line to the child line.
The DerivedFromOrderLineKey, DerivedFromOrderHeaderKey and, if applicable, DerivedFromOrderReleaseKey are set on the new OrderLine. The new OrderLine is validated, like all the other lines of the new order.
A transaction is triggered. The transaction is based on the existing order's ProcessType, and the document type of the new order. This IncludeInDerivedOrder transaction changes the status of that quantity of the existing line which is equal to the OrderedQty of the child line. If the parent line does not have sufficient quantity to derive from, error is thrown. If Action is CREATE, the PrimeLineNo is generated and SubLineNo is set to 1 . A starting number can be specified in the configurator at each document type and enterprise level for PrimeLineNo. If a starting number is specified the PrimeLineNo will be generated starting from that number.
If action is not Create , then the OrderLineKey attribute OR the PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo attributes must be passed and must be valid.
This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.

Optional. Use this element only to chain a new OrderLine with an existing OrderLine.
The existing OrderLine can be identified by using one of the following:
- OrderLineKey
- OrderHeaderKey, PrimeLineNo, and SubLineNo
- OrderNo, DocumentType, EnterpriseCode, PrimeLineNo, and SubLineNo
If the parent line cannot be identified, an error is thrown.
Information is taken from the parent line, based on the ChainedOrderOtherTemplate, stored in the YFS_DOCUMENT_TEMPLATE table. The ChainedOrderOtherTemplate is chosen on the basis of the DocumentType of the parent order.
If there are attributes passed in the createOrder input xml, the values in the passed attributes are used for creating the new OrderLine.
Schedule information is never propagated from the parent line to the child line.
The ChainedFromOrderLineKey and ChainedFromOrderHeaderKey are set on the new OrderLine. The new OrderLine is validated, like all the other lines of the new order.
A transaction is triggered. The transaction is based on the existing order's ProcessType, and the document type of the new order. This IncludeInChainedOrder transaction changes the status of that quantity of the existing line which is equal to the OrderedQty of the child line. If the parent line does not have sufficient quantity to chain from, error is thrown.
Having different any of item identifying attributes (item id, product class, unit of measure) from parent line is allowed only when inventory is not maintained by seller organization and not by by buyer organization. Error is thrown if any of them maintains.
Item attributes different from parent line.
This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.

Attribute.Name: EnterpriseCode
Attribute.Description: The enterprise that is associated with this order.

Attribute.Name: OrderNo
Attribute.Description: The order number that this order line is chained from.

Description.div: This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.

Describes the Options attached to a Delivery or a Provided Service Line. Options can only be specified for a Delivery or a Provided Service line.
An option cannot be added or removed once the OrderLine has been scheduled.
This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.

Default: MODIFY
Valid Values:
REMOVE - Removes the entire OrderLine Option. Set ModificationType to RemoveOption.
CREATE - Adds a new line Option. ModificationType to allow this change is AddOption.
MODIFY - Default value if nothing is passed. OptionItemID and OptionUOM cannot be changed even for a Draft order.
An option cannot be added or removed once the OrderLine has been scheduled.
If Action is MODIFY or REMOVE, both OptionItemID and OptionUOM must be passed to identify the OrderLineOption.
This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.
Describes the Sourcing Controls attached to a OrderLine.
This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.

Default: MODIFY
Valid Values:
REMOVE - Removes the entire OrderLine Sourcing Control. Set ModificationType to Sourcing Control Modifications.
CREATE - Adds a new line sourcing control. ModificationType to allow this change is Sourcing Control Modifications.
MODIFY - Changes an existing line sourcing control. ModificationType to allow this change is Sourcing Control Modifications.

To remove shipping address from a line, pass ShipToKey as blank and pass PersonInfoShipTo element with all blank attributes or don't pass it.
PersonInfoShipTo cannot be modified for product line once it is associated with work order.
PersonInfoShipTo cannot be modified for service if it is part of a complex work order (multi-appointment or appoinment against a service resource) or there are multiple service lines in the work order.
This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.

Attribute.Name: Action
Attribute.Description: Indicates the action that can be perfomed on the instruction detail. The valid values for Action are REMOVE or Void(Null). In case when Action is Void, it is treated as Create or Modify. InstructionDetailKey or (InstructionType and SequenceNo) can be used to indentify an instruction.

Description.div:
If the order is a draft order, SettledQuantity must not be passed.
A non-zero value passed for SettledQuantity

This flag indicates whether price information passed on the line is for information only. If it is 'Y' then line total will not be considered in order total. If it is not passed or passed as 'N' then line total is considered in order total. If this flag is not passed for a static bundle (bundle defined in the catalog), the the flag will be set on the parent and its components based on the BundlePricingStrategy defined on the item.
BundlePricingStrategy Bundle Parent Value Components Value
COMP Y Null (or N)
PARENT Null (or N) Y
ALL Null (or N) Null (or N)
If flag is changed after line is invoiced partially or fully.

The quantity which should be settled before it is actually invoiced.
DeliveryMethod takes higher precedence over SettledQuantity. In other words, if DeliveryMethod is being changed from a delivery method that requires immediate settlement to a one that does not (for example, from CARRY to SHIP), and SettledQuantity is set in the same call, then, the value passed as SettledQuantity will be ignored and SettledQuantity will be set to zero.

Attribute.Name: Reset
Attribute.Description: If reset is passed as Y, all the existing charges that are not passed as a child node will be set to zero.

Description.div: Pass this element to replace the tax information for an order line. To update the tax information for an order line, all applicable taxes (not just the modified or added tax) should be passed to the API. Tax which is not passed will be removed from the order line.

Contains tax related information for various entities in the system. If ChargeCategory and ChargeName are not provided, tax will be considered as a billable and positive charge. Whether YFSRecalculateLineTaxUE is implemented or not, ChargeCategory, Tax, and TaxPercentage are required for the repricing logic.

Attribute.Name: ChargeCategory
Attribute.Description: The charge category for which tax is being charged. For example, Labeling or Handling. To specify the tax for the line price, use the charge category Price .

Description.div: The tax amount. Tax cannot be less than zero. During the default repricing logic, this is recalculated using the TaxPercentage and the price of the related ChargeCategory. This can be overridden with the YFSRecalulateLineTaxUE.
This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.

Attribute.Name: KitQty
Attribute.Description: The number of components required to one kit.

Attribute.Name: TransactionalUOM
Attribute.Description: UOM on which all the transactional quantities are specified.

Description.div: This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.

Associate multiple lot numbers with an OrderLine.
Schedule information can be attached to order quantity at the time of adding that quantity. It cannot be specified or changed later using changeOrder.
Schedule information can be passed only if there is a change in OrderedQty. If OrderedQty is getting changed by more than the total scheduled quantity passed, then remaining quantity is created with no schedule information, or is canceled from non schedule quantity. Refer to the changeOrderSchedule API for schedule modifications.
This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.

Contains Order Line Schedule information for Order Lines. An order line can be broken up into multiple schedules. Each Schedule contains information about ShipNode, ReceivingNode, ExpectedShipmentDate, ExpectedDeliveryDate and info about any tags associated with the order line.Note that ExpectedShipmentDate and ExpectedDeliveryDate will be honoured for purchase orders while adding/removing quantity when 'Do not recompute the expected dates when requested dates on the order are changed' flag is unchecked.
If the item on the line is not tag controlled and BatchNo, LotNumber, or RevisionNo is passed.

How quantity should be changed. If quantity is being added to the line, supply a non-zero positive number. If quantity is being cancelled from the line, supply a non-zero negative number. ChangeInQuantity can be specified only for the quantity that is being added or canceled.
Total scheduled quantity is greater than the change in OrderedQty.
If ChangeInQuantity is not passed.

Attribute.Name: ChangeInQuantity
Attribute.Description: Quantity.

Attribute.Name: TransactionalUOM
Attribute.Description: UOM on which all the transactional quantities are specified.

Description.div:
Pass this element if any of the following needs to be done:
A line that depends on another line needs to be added. Refer to createOrder for validations.
Dependency information needs to be changed for an existing line.The line needs to depend on some other line. Dependency attributes are copied onto this line from the parent line depending on dependency shipping rule.
The dependency needs to be removed. Pass RemoveDependency as Y for this operation. The line is no longer be dependent on another line. DependentOnLineKey is reset on this line and ParentOfDependentGroup is reset to N on the parent line if no other line depends on this parent line. Dependency attributes defaulted to the line are retained.
Note: Modification type OTHERS is used for any change in dependency information for existing lines.

Both DependentOnPrimeLineNo and DependentOnSubLineNo must be passed for dependent OrderLines.
The DependentOnPrimeLineNo and DependentOnSubLineNo combination passed does not match any other OrderLine.

Both DependentOnPrimeLineNo and DependentOnSubLineNo must be passed for dependent OrderLines.
The DependentOnPrimeLineNo and DependentOnSubLineNo combination passed does not match any other OrderLine.

This is a virtual field meant to identify OrderLine when DependentOnPrimeLineNo and DependentOnSubLineNo is not passed. This field is is not persistent in the database.
The DependentOnTransactionalLineId passed does not match any OrderLine.
Determines if this dependency is removed. Valid Values: Y or N

Validation.Condition: If the item on the line is not tag controlled, and the OrderLineInvAttRequest element is passed.

Description.div: This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.

Action to perform on this OrderLineInvAttRequest element.
Default: Null - if not passed, OrderLineInvAttRequest element will be added if it doesn't exist or modified if it does exist.
Valid Values:
REMOVE - Removes the OrderLineInvAttRequest element from the order line.
If the item on the line is always tag controlled, the OrderLineInvAttRequest element cannot be removed.
This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.

ProductItem contains the definition of product items involved in a stand-alone service line. This definition is used to calculate the service line quantity and to identify the skills needed to provide the service. These product items will not be fulfilled as part of order fulfillment process.

Action to perform
Valid Values:
CREATE - Adds a new product item definition for the Service Line. Service line quantity will be recalculated.
REMOVE - Removes a new product item definition for the Service Line. Service line Quantity will be recalculated. If there are no other definitions existing for the Service line, its Quantity becomes zero.
The Modification Types used for adding a new definition are :
Add Product Item Definition for Stand Alone Service Line - Validates status of Service Line for which a product item definition being added. The maximum allowed status for this modification type is less than schduled.
The Modification Types used for removing a definition are:
Remove Product Item Definition for Stand Alone Service Line - Validates status of Service Line for which a product item definition being added. The maximum allowed status for this modification type is less than schduled.
For validations performed while modifying a ProductItem, refer to createOrder api documentation.

Awards that are created out of the promotions. A single promotion can result in to multiple awards. AwardId must be passed to identify the award.
PromotionId must be passed and it must be a valid one to add the award

Action to perform on this Award.
Default: Null - if not passed awards will be added if not exist or modified.
Valid Values:
REMOVE - Removes the award.
Determines whether all Promotions, except those listed below, should be removed.
Promotions that are associated to an order or any of its lines. PromotionId must be passed to identify the promotion.

Action to perform on this promotion.
Default: Null - if not passed, promotion will be added if it doesn't exist or modified if it does exist.
Valid Values:
CREATE - Add the specified promotion to the order.
REMOVE - Removes the specified promotion from the order.
If an award record is associated with this promotion, it may not be removed.
If a promotion already exists, can't add the same promotion twice.
For Coupon promotions, the overridden maximum adjustment value for the coupon pricing rule.
For Coupon promotions, if 'Y" the references will be validated and only valid references will be used

div.p: Operation to perform on this record. Default: If not passed then API will try to either create or modify depending on the existence of the data.
Modify - Change values in an existing record.

Element.Description:
Identifies the bundle parent order line for this line.
OrderLineKey or PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo or TransactionalLineId must be passed, and must identify a valid order line.

Description.div:
Action to perform
Valid Values:
CREATE - To add a component to already existing bundle. Modification ADD_COMPONENT is executed on bundle parent line.
A non-bundle parent line cannot be specified as bundle parent line.
REMOVE - To remove a component from a bundle. Modification REMOVE_COMPONENT is executed on bundle parent line.
A bundle parent line must have at least one component.

Primary key generated by the system. May be passed to identify the OrderLine. Alternatively, the TransactionalLineId or
the PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo can be passed.
The order line number. Must be passed with the SubLineNo to identify the OrderLine. Alternatively, the TransactionalLineId or the OrderLineKey can be passed.
Must be passed with the PrimeLineNo to identify the OrderLine. Alternatively, the TransactionalLineId or the OrderLineKey can be passed.

A virtual field meant to identify order lines when PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo are not passed. Used in Line Associations. This value is not stored in the database. While creating a new line and associating it with another line, the same attribute must be passed in the OrderLine element and in this element to uniquely identify a line if OrderLineKey or PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo are not present.
This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.
Optional. Stores hold type information. Multiple HoldTypes can be passed for a single order. These hold types will be applied in addition to hold types configured to be applied during create order.

The code identifying the hold type to be applied on Order.
HoldType must be defined in the configuration
This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.
The Reset flag can be passed as Y to reset all previous reservations and replace them with the new list. When reservations are removed, any inventory allocations will be cleared.

Identifies a reservation to make for the order line. Existing reservations cannot be modified directly; instead, if a new reservation is created with the same reservation attributes as an existing reservation, the new reservation will be consolidated into the existing reservation, and demand will be created for the new quantity.
If new quantity is being added to the order line in the same call that a reservation is being added, and the reservation matches the order line's attributes, then the reservation will be rolled up in to the order line, and the matching quantity will move to "Reserved" status.

The inventory demand type used by the reservation. For all user-created reservations, this will be defaulted from the document params. When promising server is present and existing inventory reservation is used in order line reservation, pass same DemandType as inventory reservation
The quantity to reserve.

The reservation ID from an existing inventory reservation. If the reservation exists, that quantity will be consumed first. Any quantity that cannot be obtained from the reservation will be reserved on the fly. If ReservationID is not passed, all quantity for this reservation will be reserved on the fly.

Attribute.Name: IsPriceLocked
Attribute.Description: Flag to indicate if the AdditionalLinePrice is Price-Locked. If passed with a value of Y, internal logic will use the passed Price from input for calculation instead of the Price generated by the Pricing Engine.

Description.div:
Operation to perform
Valid Values:
Manage - Creates a new record if it does not exist, or modifies an existing record if it does.
Create - Creates a new record.
Modify - Change values in an existing record.
Delete - Deletes an existing record.
The default behavior is Manage .
Determines whether all Promotions, except those listed below, should be removed.
Promotions that are associated to an order or any of its lines. PromotionId must be passed to identify the promotion.

Action to perform on this promotion.
Default: Null - if not passed, promotion will be added if it doesn't exist or modified if it does exist.
Valid Values:
CREATE - Add the specified promotion to the order.
REMOVE - Removes the specified promotion from the order.
If an award record is associated with this promotion, it may not be removed.
If a promotion already exists, can't add the same promotion twice.
For Coupon promotions, the overridden maximum adjustment value for the coupon pricing rule.
For Coupon promotions, if 'Y" the references will be validated and only valid references will be used

Awards that are created out of the promotions. A single promotion can result in to multiple awards. AwardId must be passed to identify the award.
PromotionId must be passed and it must be a valid one to add the award
Manual Line Charge generated by this Award must not conflict with non-manual Line Charge already on OrderLine

Action to perform on this Award.
Default: Null - if not passed awards will be added if not exist or modified.
Valid Values:
REMOVE - Removes the award.
This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.

ProductServiceAssoc contains the ProductLine and ServiceLine elements which identify the Product and Service line. Both ProductLine and ServiceLine elements must be passed to uniquely identify the lines. If multiple associations need to be made, multiple ProductServiceAssoc nodes should be passed. Refer to ProductLine and ServiceLine elements for further details.

Action to perform
Valid Values:
CREATE - Adds a new association between a Product and Service line.
REMOVE - Removes the association between the Product and the Service line. The Quantity for the Service or Delivery line is recalculated. If there are no other associations existing for the Service or Delivery line, its Quantity becomes zero. The options attached to the Delivery or Service Line are also removed if quantity has become zero.
The Modification Types used for adding a new Assocation are :
Associate Delivery Line with Product Line - Validates status of Delivery line being associated with a Product line. The maximum allowed status for this modification type is less than shipped.
Associate Product Line with Delivery Line - Validates status of Product line being associated with a Delivery line. The maximum allowed status for this modificaiton type is less than scheduled. A scheduled Product line cannot be associated with a delivery line.
Associate Service Line with Product Line - Validates status of Service lines being associated with a Product line. The maximum allowed status for this modification type is less than shipped.
Associate Product Line with Service Line - Validates status of Product lines being associated with a Service line. The maximum allowed status for this modification type is less than shipped.
When a Product and Delivery lines association is created, the first two modification types specified above are used to validate the statuses of Product and Delivery lines respectively. For association between Product and Service line, the next two modification types are used.
The Modification Types used for removing an association are:
Remove Delivery Line From Product Line Association - Validates the status of a delivery line before removing the association. The maximum allowed status for a delivery line for association removal is less than Scheduled.
Remove Service Line From Product Line Association - Validates the status of a Service line before removing the association. The association can be removed even after Service line has been completed, that is, the association can be removed even if the Service line has been shipped.
For validations performed while modifying a ProductServiceAssociation, refer to createOrder api documentation.

OrderLineRelationship contains the ParentLine and ChildLine elements which identify the Parent and Child line. Both ParentLine and ChildLine elements must be passed to uniquely identify the lines. If multiple OrderLineRelationships need to be made, multiple OrderLineRelationship nodes should be passed. Refer to ParentLine and ChildLine elements for further details.
If circular dependency is detected for order lines of the same RelationshipType. The following error is displayed.

Operation to perform
Valid Values:
Delete - Removes the relationship between the Parent and the Child line. If Operation is not passed the relationship will be created if it does not exist already.
The Modification Type used for adding a new relationships are :
Add Line Relationship - Validates status of both the Parent and the Child line for addition of the relationship. The maximum allowed status for this modification type is less than Cancelled.
The Modification Type used for removing an relationships are:
Delete Line Relationship - Validates status of both the Parent and the Child line for deletion of the relationship. The maximum allowed status for this modification type is less than Cancelled.
The type of relationship between the parent and the child line. There is no validation for the RelationshipType attribute.

div.p: Operation to perform on this record. Default: If not passed then API will try to either create or modify depending on the existence of the data.
Modify - Change values in an existing record.

Description.div: This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.

Attribute.Name: Action
Attribute.Description: Indicates the action that can be perfomed on the instruction detail. The valid values for Action are REMOVE or Void(Null). In case when Action is Void, it is treated as Create or Modify. InstructionDetailKey or (InstructionType and SequenceNo) can be used to indentify an instruction.

Description.div: This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.

Attribute.Name: Reset
Attribute.Description: If reset is passed as Y, all the existing charges that are not passed as a child node will be set to zero.

Description.div: Pass this element to replace the tax information. To update the tax information for an order, all applicable taxes (not just the modified or added tax) should be passed to the API. Tax which is not passed will be removed from the order.

Contains tax related information for various entities in the system. If ChargeCategory and ChargeName are not provided, tax will be considered as a billable and positive charge. Whether YFSRecalculateHeaderTaxUE is implemented or not, ChargeCategory, Tax, and TaxPercentage are required for the repricing logic.

The tax amount. Tax cannot be less than zero. During the default repricing logic, this is recalculated using the TaxPercentage and the price of the related ChargeCategory. This can be overridden with the YFSRecalulateHeaderTaxUE.
This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.

Attribute.Name: Name
Attribute.Description: Name of the Reference

Attribute.Name: Value
Attribute.Description: Value of the Reference

Description.div:
PaymentMethod can be added, modified or removed .
If payment processing is not required for the order, any payment method passed in the input xml is still subject to validations.
Only the PaymentMethod attributes specified in the input xml can be changed. Attempting to change other attributes on PaymentMethod , such as TotalAuthorized or TotalCharged results in an error.
Pass changed value for attributes not specfied in input xml.

Indicates the action to take on the PaymentMethod. Valid Value: Only valid value is REMOVE .
For the addition or modification of PaymentMethod, Action does not have to be passed; if passed, its value should be Null or any value other than REMOVE . When a PaymentMethod is removed, its associated ChargeTransaction records and CreditCardTransaction records are also removed.
Action is REMOVE , and any of the following is not zero: PendingAuthAmount, PendingChargeAmount, TotalAuthorized, TotalCharged,RequestedAuthAmount, RequestedChargeAmount or TotalRefundedAmount.

If passed as Y and the order is in PAID status, the fields CreditCardNo,CustomerAccountNo,SvcNo,PaymentReference1 can be modified, even if the Order is in Paid Status. This can be used for masking the values of the sensitive payment details. The corresponding masked value of CreditCardNo,CustomerAccountNo,SvcNo,PaymentReference1 should be passed alongwith. Override is not permitted unless the order is in PAID status.
Valid Values: Y or N

Used to identify the order to which charges are applied.
The Seller Organization can configure the payment types so that they are charged and refunded in a particular sequence. The charge sequence and refund sequence are independent of each other. A PaymentType with a ChargeSequence set to
0
is charged before another PaymentType with ChargeSequence set to
1
.
The Buyer can also specify the ChargeSequence of the PaymentMethod in the createOrder input xml. If a charge sequence is not specified by the Buyer, the Seller's ChargeSequence is followed.
If both the Buyer and the Seller supply ChargeSequence , charges are made in the order that the Seller specifies, but within a particular charge type, such as CreditCard, the Buyer's sequence is honored.
For example:
A seller specifies the ChargeSequence as 0 for CUSTOMER_ACCOUNT, 1 for CREDIT_CARD, 2 for OTHER.
A buyer specifies the ChargeSequence as 1 for MyBank-CreditCard, 2 for CUSTOMER_ACCOUNT, and 3 for MyOther-CreditCard.
The payment methods are charged in the following sequence:
CUSTOMER_ACCOUNT, MyBank-CreditCard, MyOther-CreditCard.
The Customer account is charged because that is the seller's preferred method, and the two credit cards are charged based on the order that the buyer specified.
The Entry Type used to enter payment information into the system.

Type of payment.
The PaymentType must be a value that is already configured for the Seller Organization.
If a PaymentMethod element is passed, the PaymentType is validated, even if payment processing is not required for the order.
Must be a value defined for the Seller Organization.
PaymentType must be passed.

Indicates if external charges are being recorded for an asynchronous request. Valid values are 'Y', 'N' or Void. Set this flag to "Y" with a valid RequestAmount to indicate that the external charges are being recorded for an asynchronous request. This will enable the system to adjust the pending asynchronous amounts correctly. Set the flag to "N" to indicate that the external charges are being recorded for non-asynchronous request. In this mode, system will not process any pending asynchronous amounts. Set this flag to Void or Do not pass this flag, if unsure the request is asynchronous or not. In this mode system will try to adjust any pending asynchronous amounts that exists for the request. This mode is provided for backward compatibility.

Description.p: This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.

Description.div: This field is used as an Identifier for recording a response for transaction closed as asynchronous. Pass AsyncRequestIdentifier only when ReducePendingAsyncronousAmounts flag is set to "Y". AsyncRequestIdentifier will be ignored if ReducePendingAsyncronousAmounts flag is passed as "N". Use AsyncRequestIdentifier as an identifier to record the response of a asynchronous transaction only once. AsyncRequestIdentifier can be associated to a asynchronously closed transaction in the user exit.

Description.p: AuditTransactionID is a user defined data. This data will be stored on YFS_ORDER_AUDIT table. Also in case of APIs that cause the creation of a CHARGE_REQUEST, the same field will be stored on YFS_CHARGE_TRANSACTION table.

The type of charge that is being applied to the order.
Valid Values: AUTHORIZATION or CHARGE . Invalid value is passed.
The date and time when the charge is realized.It can be future date.When this date is passed in input xml, Is_Collection_Date_Firm flag is set to Y.

This flag indicates whether or not pre-authorized or pre-charged amounts for the entire order will be held until the order is completely invoiced. If passed as 'Y', they will be. If passed as 'N', or not passed, the extra charge or authorization amount is not held. For example, if there are two units of $5 each on an pre-paid order, and $10 are collected up front, then when HoldAgainstBook is passed as 'N', a refund for $5 is created upon invoicing of the first unit. When passed as 'Y', no refund is created. If the pre-charged amount is $12 for the order, and when HoldAgainstBook is passed as 'N', a refund is created for $7 upon invoicing of the first unit, and for $2 when HoldAgainstBook is passed as 'Y'.

This flag indicates that the transaction represents an in person, or card in hand, transaction. A transaction that is in person will distribute against in person order totals and invoices, and vice versa.

This flag indicates the transaction attempted to reach the payment gateway but was unable to contact it. This should only be passed for unprocessed records, as this may be updated to N by the user exit, and will be reset to null when the record moves to CLOSED status.

The EntryType used to enter payment information into the system, such as by a magnetic card reader. If passed, this attribute will take precedence over other attributes for the entry type of the transaction.

If ProcessedAmount is passed as a value greater than zero, the STATUS in the CHARGE_TRANSACTION table is set to CLOSED .
If ProcessedAmount is passed as zero or not passed, the STATUS will be set to OPEN, unless RequestProcessed is passed as Y. The ProcessedAmount is used to update CHARGE_TRANSACTION table, depending on the charge type. If the ChargeType value is :
AUTHORIZATION - the OpenAuthorizedAmount is updated with the ProcessedAmount.
CHARGE - the CreditAmount is updated with the ProcessedAmount.
This field can be used to store reason code for transaction update.

For ChargeTypes CHARGE and AUTHORIZATION, this field holds the amount that is requested for charging/authorization. If RequestAmount is passed, it is set as the RequestAmount of the chargetransaction record and the TranAmount of the creditcardtransaction record.

If the value of this is Y , the payment details record will be treated as already processed. This flag is considered only when ProcessedAmount is 0 . Request with ProcessedAmount greater than or less than 0 is always considered as processed.
This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.

Description.div: This field is used as an Identifier for recording a response for transaction closed as asynchronous. Pass AsyncRequestIdentifier only when ReducePendingAsyncronousAmounts flag is set to "Y". AsyncRequestIdentifier will be ignored if ReducePendingAsyncronousAmounts flag is passed as "N". Use AsyncRequestIdentifier as an identifier to record the response of a asynchronous transaction only once. AsyncRequestIdentifier can be associated to a asynchronously closed transaction in the user exit.

Description.p: AuditTransactionID is a user defined data. This data will be stored on YFS_ORDER_AUDIT table. Also in case of APIs that cause the creation of a CHARGE_REQUEST, the same field will be stored on YFS_CHARGE_TRANSACTION table.

The type of charge that is being applied to the order.
Valid Values: AUTHORIZATION or CHARGE . Invalid value is passed.
The date and time when the charge is realized.It can be future date.When this date is passed in input xml, Is_Collection_Date_Firm flag is set to Y.

This flag indicates whether or not pre-authorized or pre-charged amounts for the entire order will be held until the order is completely invoiced. If passed as 'Y', they will be. If passed as 'N', or not passed, the extra charge or authorization amount is not held. For example, if there are two units of $5 each on an pre-paid order, and $10 are collected up front, then when HoldAgainstBook is passed as 'N', a refund for $5 is created upon invoicing of the first unit. When passed as 'Y', no refund is created. If the pre-charged amount is $12 for the order, and when HoldAgainstBook is passed as 'N', a refund is created for $7 upon invoicing of the first unit, and for $2 when HoldAgainstBook is passed as 'Y'.

This flag indicates that the transaction represents an in person, or card in hand, transaction. A transaction that is in person will distribute against in person order totals and invoices, and vice versa.

This flag indicates the transaction attempted to reach the payment gateway but was unable to contact it. This should only be passed for unprocessed records, as this may be updated to N by the user exit, and will be reset to null when the record moves to CLOSED status.

The EntryType used to enter payment information into the system, such as by a magnetic card reader. If passed, this attribute will take precedence over other attributes for the entry type of the transaction.

If ProcessedAmount is passed as a value greater than zero, the STATUS in the CHARGE_TRANSACTION table is set to CLOSED .
If ProcessedAmount is passed as zero or not passed, the STATUS will be set to OPEN, unless RequestProcessed is passed as Y. The ProcessedAmount is used to update CHARGE_TRANSACTION table, depending on the charge type. If the ChargeType value is :
AUTHORIZATION - the OpenAuthorizedAmount is updated with the ProcessedAmount.
CHARGE - the CreditAmount is updated with the ProcessedAmount.
This field can be used to store reason code for transaction update.

For ChargeTypes CHARGE and AUTHORIZATION, this field holds the amount that is requested for charging/authorization. If RequestAmount is passed, it is set as the RequestAmount of the chargetransaction record and the TranAmount of the creditcardtransaction record.

If the value of this is Y , the payment details record will be treated as already processed. This flag is considered only when ProcessedAmount is 0 . Request with ProcessedAmount greater than or less than 0 is always considered as processed.

Attribute.Name: ResetMileStoneStatus
Attribute.Description: Milestone status for which order dates needs to be reset.

Description.div: This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.
Specifies whether the Special Service Code needs to be added or removed for the order. Valid values are CREATE, REMOVE

The code identifying the Special Service to be performed on the Order.
SpecialServicesCode must be defined in the configuration
This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.
Optional. Stores hold type information. Multiple HoldTypes can be applied/ removed for a single order.

The code identifying the hold type to be applied/ removed for an Order.
HoldType must be defined in the configuration

This attribute specifies the status of the order hold type.
Valid Values:
1100 - To apply a HoldType to order.
1200 - To reject a HoldType from order.
1300 - To resolve a HoldType from order.
Default: Hold type is always created in '1100' status.
This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.
Specify Action = REMOVE to remove the entity. Leave Action Null or don't include it for modifying or creating a new entity.

Attribute.Name: PersonInfoKey
Attribute.Description: The person info record to store this answer set for.

Description.div:
The question type associated to the defined answer set.
QuestionType not passed.
Invalid QuestionType.

Attribute.Name: Reset
Attribute.Description: Indicates if all existing child node definition in the database need to be scrapped and have only these definitions supplied in the XML.

Description.div: Specify Action = REMOVE to remove the entity. Leave Action Null or don't include it for modifying or creating a new entity.

The answer for the question.
AnswerValue passed should be a valid answer for the question it belongs to.

Identifier for the question that this answer is for.
QuestionID should be valid.
Determines whether all Promotions, except those listed below, should be removed.
Promotions that are associated to an order or any of its lines. PromotionId must be passed to identify the promotion.

Action to perform on this promotion.
Default: Null - if not passed, promotion will be added if it doesn't exist or modified if it does exist.
Valid Values:
CREATE - Add the specified promotion to the order.
REMOVE - Removes the specified promotion from the order.
If an award record is associated with this promotion, it may not be removed.
If a promotion already exists, can't add the same promotion twice.
For Coupon promotions, the overridden maximum adjustment value for the coupon pricing rule.
For Coupon promotions, if 'Y" the references will be validated and only valid references will be used

Promotion references associated to the promotion. In case of internal promotions, the promotion references will be automatically associated to the generated awards proportional to the awarded quantity.

Operation to perform
Valid Values:
Delete - Removes the PromotionReference. If Operation is not passed the PromotionReference will be created if it does not exist already.

Awards that are created out of the promotions. A single promotion can result in to multiple awards. AwardId must be passed to identify the award.
PromotionId must be passed and it must be a valid one to add the award

Action to perform on this Award.
Default: Null - if not passed awards will be added if not exist or modified.
Valid Values:
REMOVE - Removes the award.

Attribute.Name: TotalNumberOfRecords
Attribute.Description: Number of Attachments in the Order.

Attribute.Name: FileAttachmentKey
Attribute.Description: The key of the attached file

Attribute.Name: FileContentType
Attribute.Description: Type of the file content as returned by FileUploadServlet

Attribute.Name: FileDescription
Attribute.Description: Description of the file content as returned by FileUploadServlet

Attribute.Name: FileLocation
Attribute.Description: The location of the file as returned by FileUploadServlet

Attribute.Name: FileName
Attribute.Description: Complete name of the file as returned by FileUploadServlet

Attribute.Name: FileSize
Attribute.Description: Size of the file as returned by FileUploadServlet

Description.div:
Action to take
Valid Value:
Delete - Deletes the file attachment.

Tag identifier.
TagId must be passed.

Attribute.Name: Reset
Attribute.Description: Determines whether the OrderSearchConditions should be reset.

Validation.Condition:
Must pass one of the following combinations:
the OrderNo, EnterpriseCode and the DocumentType
or EntityAttributeName or the EntityAttributeValue.

Attribute.Name: Reset
Attribute.Description: The Reset flag can be passed as Y to reset all previous transactional relationships and replace them with the new list.

Description.div: This table stores details about the relationship between two transactional records.

div.p: Operation to perform on this record. Default: If not passed then API will try to either create or modify depending on the existence of the data.
Modify - Change values in an existing record.

Description.div: The TableName of the related transactional record.
If not passed, it will be defaulted to TableName.

The type of relationship between the two transactional records.
The RelationshipType must be passed.
